cui_name: Congenital diaphragmatic hernia with severe respiratory insufficiency
reasoning: Congenital diaphragmatic hernia (CDH) incidence ~2-4 per 100k live births globally, with wide geographic variation. Approximately 30-40% of cases present with severe respiratory insufficiency requiring immediate intervention. Estimated severe CDH incidence ~0.8-1.2 per 100k births. This coding may reflect severity modifier. Uses incidence metric for congenital condition.
source: Bianchi DW et al. (2012). Prenatal diagnosis of congenital diaphragmatic hernia. Prenat Diagn. 32(6):526-532
